intro: Carlomohria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down. Carlomohria is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
